questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following food types would most likely give a negative result upon addition of iodine solution? .
Which process produces mRNA during protein synthesis?
What is the molecule in plant cells that first captures the radiant energy from sunlight?
Of the following functions, which one do triglycerides accomplish in cells?
questionList.choiceA: Increase density of tissues and cells
questionList.choiceC: Yield limited amount of ATP for cells
questionList.choiceD: Facilitate entry of excess water into cells

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following laboratory glassware is used for culturing bacteria?
Of the following, which one is the main source from which plants get the nutrients necessary for their growth and development?
Which of the following is the correct sequence of the steps in scientific research?
Which of the following types of cancer is known to mostly develop in AIDS patients?
How many fatty acids would a cell need to form a molecule of triglyceride?
Which part of the human alimentary canal contains digestive enzymes that function at acidic pH?
Which of the following is the correct constitution of the sex chromosome of a normal woman?
From which of the following does the 0<sub>2</sub> released during the process of photosynthesis originate?
What is the best term that expresses the movement of substances in cells against their concentration gradients?
In cell division, what is the phase that comes following the metaphase called?
Who was the person that first observed living cells moving around when he examined drops of water under the microscope?
Which of the following is true about gene mutation?
questionList.choiceA: Altering the DNA sequence of a gene
questionList.choiceB: Change in the position of a block of genes
questionList.choiceC: Addition of genes to a chromosome
questionList.choiceD: Loss of genes from a chromosome

questionList.questionStatement: What is the circumstance that causes the health condition known as sickle—cell anaemia?
Based on similarity in number of amino acids found in haemoglobin, which one of the following animals has closer phylogenetic relations to human beings?
In which of the following groups of living organisms do the cells lack organized nuclei? ‘
Which one of the following terms refers to the failure of sister chromatids to separate from one another during anaphase?
If two species are known to belong to the same order, they must also belong to which taxonomic category?
What happens in the first reaction of the Krebs cycle during energy transformation?
What do you call structures that have the same evolutionary origin even though they may now have different structural make ups or functions?
For what purpose do biologists use the GPS receiver?
Which of the following organisms usually forms the pioneer community in a primary biological succession?
In an experiment designed to the effect of temperature on the rate of seed germination, which of the following should the experimenter vary?
In the carbon cycle, which of the following processes removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere?
Which of the following sequences represent the correct change in number of chromosomes during fertilization?
“Rats can be produced by keeping rags and grains at a corner of a room”. Which of the following line of thinking supports this statement?
What is the specific name of biological scientists who do research that tries to find evidence of life on other planets in the Solar System?
Which of the following industries can reduce more CO2 emission by shifting to the use of enzymes in the manufacturing process?
Which of the following is made of globular proteins?
Which one of the following events happened before all the others?
questionList.choiceD: The structure of DNA was described.

questionList.questionStatement: Under what conditions do C4 plants have more photosynthetic efficiency than C3 plants?
Which of the following is NOT a universal property of all living things?
In which area of enzyme application is invertase injected to sucrose paste in order to produce liquid chocolates?
Which one of the following functions best at higher optimum pH than all the rest?
Which class of enzymes joins two molecules together by formation of new bonds?
Which of the following has a bigger size than all the others?
questionList.choiceA: A ribosome taken from animal cell
questionList.choiceB: A mitochondria taken from a plant cell
questionList.choiceC: A nerve cell taken from a human brain
questionList.choiceD: A glucose molecule taken from a plant cell

questionList.questionStatement: How does a simple microscope differ from a compound microscope?
questionList.choiceA: A simple microscope has no lens.
questionList.choiceB: A simple microscope has got two lenses.
questionList.choiceC: A simple microscope uses mirror as lens.
questionList.choiceD: A simple microscope has only one lens.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following molecules can serve as a raw material for industries that produce glucose?
In enzymes that contain non—protein organic molecules, in addition to the protein component, what is the protein component called?
Which one of the following should be done in order to remove an enzyme inhibition caused by a competitive inhibitor?
questionList.choiceB: Add more substrate to the system
questionList.choiceC: Remove the end product of the reaction
questionList.choiceD: Add more inhibitor to the system

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following parts of the plant cell is NOT a living component of the cell?
What are the possible consequences of deforestation of the tropical rainforest?
questionList.choiceA: An increase in existing ecological niches
questionList.choiceB: Reduction in species diversity of an area
questionList.choiceC: Increased removal of CO2 from the atmosphere
questionList.choiceD: An increase in the amount of nitrogen in the soil

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following processes releases CO2 into the atmosphere?
If an area is dominated by just one species having Very many individuals, what would be its index of diversity?
Which of the following is true about sex determination in birds?
questionList.choiceA: They have the heterozygotic X & Y chromosomes.
questionList.choiceB: Males have heterozygotic W & Z chromosomes.
questionList.choiceC: Females have the homozygotic WW chromosomes.
questionList.choiceD: They have the heterozygotic W & Z chromosomes.

questionList.questionStatement: How many amino acids are there in all known proteins?
Which of the following is the major mechanism by which AIDS is transmitted?
What percentage of the F2 progeny of a monohybrid cross is expected to have the recessive phenotype?
Which of the following is NOT true about innate behaviours?
questionList.choiceA: Can be improved by trial and error
questionList.choiceB: Common to all members of the species
questionList.choiceC: Present at birth or on hatching
questionList.choiceD: Do not have to be learned

questionList.questionStatement: To which one of the following classes of “stimuli do pheromones belong?
Which of the following types of microscopes is most suitable for a detailed study of the surface structure of an object?
According to the ﬂuid-mosaic model of the plasma membrane, what does the word 'mosaic' refer to?
questionList.choiceA: The hydrophobic property of fatty acids
questionList.choiceB: The bilayer nature of the membrane

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following diseases is correctly matched with its causative agent?
Which of the following organic compounds would release both nitrogen and sulfur to the ecosystem when decomposed?
Among the vertebrates found in Ethiopia, which class has the highest percentage of endemic species?
Which of the following terms refers to the movement of individuals out of a population?
Which of the following crosses will produce progeny with phenotypic ratio of 3:1 ?
questionList.choiceA: Crossing the F1 to the dominant parent
questionList.choiceC: Crossing the F1 to the recessive parent

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following changes that happened during  human evolution had the most contribution to the  evolutionary success of Homo sapiens?
questionList.choiceA: Proportionately big brain size to body mass
questionList.choiceB: Big body parts and big overall body mass
questionList.choiceC: Long legs, arms and more upright body posture
questionList.choiceD: Fast running ability and overall physical strength

questionList.questionStatement: Woodlice are observed avoiding light and heat by quickly moving to moist and darker areas. Which behavior of these animals helps them to detect differences in light intensity and move to the darker and moist part of the habitat?
In Ethiopian animal diversity, which group is represented by the highest number of orders, families, generation and species?
Why are mutations considered important in evolution?
questionList.choiceA: They are usually related to the environment.
questionList.choiceB: They contribute to new variations in organisms.
questionList.choiceC: They are always beneficial to the organism.
questionList.choiceD: They become causes for species migrations.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following processes involved in the water cycle is carried out by green plants?
Deficiency of which of the following nutrients in human diet is likely to result in a deficiency of some co-enzymes like FAD?
If someone suddenly removes his/her hand from a very hot object, which of the following types of behavior is manifested?
Which step in the HIV life cycle is disrupted by an anti-retroviral drug that competitively inhibits the reverse transcriptase enzyme?
questionList.choiceB: Assembly of viral parts into a virus
questionList.choiceD: Integration of viral DNA into host DNA

questionList.questionStatement: During which of the following processes in cellular respiration are most of the ATPS formed?
Which of the following pairs are ANALOGOUS structures?
questionList.choiceA: The human arm and the front leg of a mule
questionList.choiceB: The front leg of a frog and the wing of a bat
questionList.choiceC: The wing of a bird and the wing of a butterﬂy
questionList.choiceD: The wing of a bat and the wing of a bird

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following involves trial and error learning?
Which of the following is the adaptation by C4 plants that helps them to avoid photorespiration?
questionList.choiceA: Harvesting of carbon dioxide at night
questionList.choiceB: Using separate cells for light & dark reactions
questionList.choiceC: Storing carbon dioxide in the vacuole
questionList.choiceD: Keeping the stomata closed during the day

questionList.questionStatement: If a codon on a messenger RNA is UUU, what is the complementary anticodon on the transfer RNA?
If clone is produces by transferring a nucleus of animal A to an enucleated egg of animal B and the egg is then implanted in the uterus of animal C, Which animal would the clone resemble most?
Which of the following classes of fatty acids is carbon—carbon double bond?
Choose the one that had the LEAST contribution to human evolution?
In which biome are epiphytes typically present as L a characteristic element?
If it is known that the total amount of DNA in a cell is 300 units and that adenine alone contributes 70 of these units, how many units go to cytosine?
What is the substance that helps to keep the biological membrane in a ﬂuid state?
Which of the following substances is NOT formed when glucose is fermented by yeasts?
Which phosphate bond of the ATP is broken when the energy it contains is needed for cellular activity?
What is the advantage that a photo system containing molecules of different types of light sensitive pigments have?
questionList.choiceA: To absorb light of different wave lengths
questionList.choiceB: To increase the size of the photosystem
questionList.choiceC: To increase the complexity of the photosystem
questionList.choiceD: To increase the surface area for light absorption

questionList.questionStatement: How many years have passed since Darwin’s book on the theory of evolution was published?
Which of the following can be understood about living things from the study of how breeders improve domesticated plants and animals?
questionList.choiceB: Natural resources are of limited supply
questionList.choiceC: Living things can be improved through selection

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is responsible for the bending of a young plant towards a unidirectional source of light?
questionList.choiceB: Faster growth rate on the dark side
questionList.choiceC: Reduced auxin concentration on dark side
questionList.choiceD: Increased rate of cell division on the light side

questionList.questionStatement: In what way would AIDS patients benefit from treatment with anti-retroviral drugs?
If a country has a larger number of young people relative to the number of old people, to which category of countries does. it belong?
Which of the following is the best collective name for all bacteria with spherical shapes?
Suppose two heterozygous round yellow (RrYy x RrYy) pea plants were crossed and l28 seeds were produced, how many of the seeds are expected to be heterozygous round yellow?
Which of the following is an important way by which green plants mitigate the greenhouse effect?
questionList.choiceA: Use of fire wood to replace coal

questionList.questionStatement: What causes tomato fruits to ripen much more slowly when kept in a refrigerator than if left on a table at room temperature?
questionList.choiceA: Low temperature slows the normal action of ripening enzymes.
questionList.choiceB: Enzymes produced by bacteria normally inhibit ripening.
questionList.choiceC: Humidity accelerates enzyme activity and ripening process.
questionList.choiceD: Normal temperature arrests the action of ripening enzymes.

questionList.questionStatement: Which characteristic of RNA makes it suitable for moving out of the nucleus?
Why does sucrose give a negative result when mixed and heated with Benedict's solution?
questionList.choiceA: Because it is not a sugar molecule.
questionList.choiceB: Because it is a reducing sugar.
questionList.choiceC: Because it is a non-reducing sugar.
questionList.choiceD: Because it is not a monosaccharide.

questionList.questionStatement: What does an evolutionary selective pressure that acts around the mean do?
Which of the following is consistent with science?
questionList.choiceA: Proof by investigation of the causes of a phenomenon
questionList.choiceB: Proof by reference to a respected leader
questionList.choiceC: Proof by reference to an unknown object
questionList.choiceD: Proof based on lessons from a person one believes

questionList.questionStatement: In his theory of evolution, the cause of which of the  following concepts was MISSING in Darwin's explanation?

questionList.choiceA: Suckling of the newborn at mother's breasts
questionList.choiceB: Salivation by conditioned dogs at the sound of a bell
questionList.choiceC: Withdrawal of hands suddenly from hot objects
questionList.choiceD: Blinking the eyes when something gets into them

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following diseases is transmitted by mosquitoes?

questionList.choiceA: Centrifuges, microscopes, measuring cylinders, petri dishes
questionList.choiceC: Centrifuges, plant presses, flow meters, microscopes
questionList.choiceD: Theodolites, petri dishes, GPS receivers, measuring cylinders

questionList.questionStatement: Which aspect of biotechnology is considered strictly genetic engineering?
questionList.choiceB: Production of new types of plants
